neighbors.name: Bebe Davis Tucker
neighbors.claims: Bebe Davis Tucker is a Saline County landowner in the vicinity of the proposed battery storage site; local residents in her area filed a protest petition to block that project in late 2025 [KWCH](https://www.kwch.com/2026/01/06/saline-county-commission-rejects-proposed-battery-storage-facility-after-resident-petition/). Neighbors, reflecting views she likely shares, argued that such industrial development “did not fit the landscape or their rural lifestyle” in the community [KSAL](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person through a familiar neighbor or community member she trusts. Emphasize respect for her rural lifestyle and explain what will be done to maintain the peace, quiet, and agricultural character of the area.

neighbors.name: Rodney A. Bradshaw
neighbors.claims: Rodney A. Bradshaw and his wife (Arzella) have operated a Kansas farm made up of five land parcels, indicating a substantial stake in local agriculture [FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/court/us-10th-circuit/2009267.html). He joined other Saline County landowners in formally protesting a 2025 plan to site a battery storage facility near his property, citing safety and incompatibility with the rural community’s character [KWCH](https://www.kwch.com/2026/01/06/saline-county-commission-rejects-proposed-battery-storage-facility-after-resident-petition/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small farm owner; not in office

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted agricultural advisor or local official initiate dialogue. Acknowledge his concerns about safety and property rights, and highlight any community oversight measures or land-use protections that give him a sense of control over the project’s impacts.

neighbors.name: Steven G. Dunning & Cynthia D. Dunning
neighbors.claims: Steven G. Dunning, 83, and his wife Cynthia D. Dunning co-own farmland in Saline County but reside in Urich, Missouri [Veripages](https://veripages.com/name/Steve/Dunning/). They have not been identified in local news or county records voicing any position on energy or development projects [Saline Co. Commissioners Deny Battery Project](https://citizenportal.ai/articles/7256034/kansas/saline-county/saline-county-commissioners-deny-conditional-use-permit-for-proposed-battery-storage-project).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local farmer or community member reach out on the project’s behalf. Emphasize that the development will not disrupt the quiet rural environment or scenic landscape they value, and address any safety or environmental concerns they might have.

neighbors.name: Ellen Kay Ward
neighbors.claims: Ellen Kay Ward owns agricultural land within the notification area of a proposed 40-acre energy storage site in Saline County [Saline Co. Commissioners Deny Battery Project](https://citizenportal.ai/articles/7256034/kansas/saline-county/saline-county-commissioners-deny-conditional-use-permit-for-proposed-battery-storage-project). More than 20% of nearby landowners formally protested that project via petition, yet Ward herself has not been noted making any public comment on development issues [KSAL News](https://www.ksal.com/4-1-vote-stops-power-storage-facility-project/).
neighbors.influence_justification: No evident civic or leadership role

approach_recommendations.engage: Send a courteous letter or phone call to her since she lives outside the area. Explain how the project will preserve the area’s quiet, rural character and reassure that it won’t negatively impact her property’s value or the community’s safety.
